KANSAS CITY, Mo. — Jingle KC said Thursday that event staff will receive 100% of the money they are owed, with most payments being made next week and the rest by the end of January.
This update follows threats of legal action from a group of Jingle workers who claimed they were owed thousands of dollars.
Advertisement In a statement, Jingle explained that the company managing its revenue had redirected funds intended for payroll, causing the delay in payments.
Statement from Jingle:
"Jingle is providing an update that all employees will receive 100% of their payroll due, with most payments being made next week. Any remaining payroll will be completed no later than Jan. 31. This information has been provided directly to employees, as well as to the Missouri and Kansas departments of labor.
We want to express our deepest regret that this situation arose. As we’ve shared before, the company managing Jingle’s revenue and ticket sales redirected funds originally intended for payroll to cover other expenses. While this has been an incredibly challenging situation, please know that Jingle has done everything in its power to make this right."
You can read more background on the situation here .
